publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2124 Shona Robison: Fibromyalgia Awareness Week 15 - 22 September 2001—That the Parliament notes and supports Fibromyalgia Awareness Week that aims to raise the awareness of the "hidden" disability that affects up to 100,000 people in Scotland; recognises the problems faced by sufferers in claiming appropriate benefits and accessing appropriate and sympathetic treatment, and calls for more research into the condition so that Fibromyalgia Syndrome is treated as the serious illness it is. Supported by: Ms Sandra White*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Irene McGugan*, Michael Russell*
S1M-2124 Fibromyalgia Awareness Week 15 - 22 September 2001 (lodged on 23 August 2001) Alex Neil*, Christine Grahame*

Supported by: Ms Sandra White, Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Irene McGugan, Michael Russell, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Tricia Marwick*, Kay Ullrich*
S1M-2124 Fibromyalgia Awareness Week 15 - 22 September 2001 (lodged on 23 August 2001) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2124 Fibromyalgia Awareness Week 15 - 22 September 2001 (lodged on 23 August 2001) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Donald Gorrie*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S1M-2124 Fibromyalgia Awareness Week 15 - 22 September 2001 (lodged on 23 August 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Linda Fabiani*, Mary Scanlon*
